title: Missing Content Security Policy enable/disable setting on about:config
content:
Hello,

I noticed that a setting on the about:config page was removed: the "security.csp.enable" setting. I was using this setting to disable CSP to be able to load local JS scripts on some non-locally hosted sites, for debugging and development, work related purposes.

Was this setting really removed? Is there a way to disable CSP on Firefox on the latest version?

Thanks! Gabriel.
creator: gabrielmuttiteixeira

title: Malwarebytes website
content:
I have been trying to get on the Malwarebytes website, but I keep getting;

Your connection is not secure

The owner of links.malwarebytes.com has configured their website improperly. To protect your information from being stolen, Firefox has not connected to this website.

links.malwarebytes.com uses an invalid security certificate. The certificate is only valid for the following names: *.fortinet.com, fortinet.com Error code: SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN


This happens with all of my web browsers. Is it safe to allow FortinetÂ ?
creator: fredmcd-hotmail

title: Facebook won't load in a container tab.
content:
I just updated my Mac to OS 12.3.1 (from Big Sur). I did a clean install of the OS, but used Migration Assistant for all of my applications and settings. For some reason, all of my Firefox Add-Ons disappeared, for whatever that's worth.

The issue I'm having is that Facebook won't load in a container page. I don't have the Facebook Container Add-On installed, I'm only using the Firefox native container settings.

FB does load in Banking or Shopping container tabs, but not in a Facebook container tab. The log in page loads, and the 2 factor authorization page, but once I get past that, I see nothing but a white page.

Instagram loads just fine in a Facebook container, though. Banking and Shopping containers seem to be working fine otherwise, too.

Any advice or suggestions would be appreciated, thanks.
creator: ivan.rhudick

title: Unable to Access Washington Post
content: I can no longer access The Washington Post using Firefox even though I have a subscription. The website pops up for a minute and then disappears. I have done a search for help with this problem, but I've not found a solution. This doesn't happen with any other site. Any suggestions for how to remedy this problem?
creator: diane.franklin
